lessons.title: Lesson 1 Greetings and Introductions
lessons.description:
Our German Language journey will start with the basic greetings in the German language. In this video we will learn different ways to greet people in various parts of Germany. 
Along with the Greetings, you will also see the English translation of each new word that you will learn, don't forget to note them down and learn them by heart because this will help you in expanding your vocabulary with each new lesson. 
You may be wondering, why we are beginning the A1 Level with basic greetings. It's because, before we get into the grammar and other details, it's important to get a hang of the language. That will result into having a better understanding of the language.
lessons.content:
German greetings vary depending on the time of day and formality. Here are the essentials:

  • Guten Morgen - Good morning (until about 10am)
  • Guten Tag - Good day (10am to dusk)
  • Guten Abend - Good evening
  • Hallo - Hello (informal)

lessons.title: Lesson 2 Common Phrases
lessons.description:
Learn German Lesson 2 -  Common phrases | H√§ufige Redemittel
In Lesson 2 you will learn some common phrases that you will come across in your daily life in Germany. Knowing these phrases makes the conversations much more politer, structured and relatable. 
Some of the phrases you will be learning in this video are: 
--   "Vielen Dank" (Thank you very much)
--   "Wie bitte?" (I beg your pardon)
--   "Sprechen Sie Deutsch?" (Do you speak German?) 
At the end of the video you will find a quick overview of all the phrases that you learned.
lessons.content:
German numbers are straightforward but have some unique pronunciations:

1-10:

eins, zwei, drei, vier, f√ºnf, sechs, sieben, acht, neun, zehn

11-20:

elf, zw√∂lf, dreizehn, vierzehn, f√ºnfzehn, sechzehn, siebzehn, achtzehn, neunzehn, zwanzig

lessons.title: Lesson 3 Numbers 0-20
lessons.description:
In Lesson 3 you will learn numbers from 1 to 20.
From paying money to asking someone's phone number, numbers are everywhere. Not only are the numbers an essential part of learning a language but they are also a very important thing to know for the smooth sailing of everyday life in any country. 
The numbers in German are both easy to speak and easy to remember. Further you will be given some tips on how to memorise them. At the end of the lesson, you will be able to tell your mobile number in German! Isn't that great?
lessons.content:

eins, zwei, drei, vier, f√ºnf, sechs, sieben, acht, neun, zehn

lessons.title: Lesson 4 Common Phrases
lessons.description:
In Lesson 4 you will learn numbers from 20 to 100.
After learning numbers 1-20 in the previous lesson, it's time to learn the numbers from 20-100. Not only that, after learning these numbers, you will have a good command over the pronunciation.
The numbers are very well illustrated in the video to make them easily understandable. You will be able to memorise them fast and can easily attempt the simple exercise in the video. Soon you should be able to start using them in your conversations. 
At the end of the lesson you should be able to tell your age in German. üòâ

lessons.title: Lesson 5 | Alphabets
lessons.description:
In Lesson 5 you will learn the German alphabets.
After getting a hang of the language, it's now time to learn the German Alphabets. You will see that the German alphabets are written same as the English alphabets but their pronunciation is a bit different. So make sure to re-watch the videos as many times if you want to learn the correct pronunciation of all the alphabets. 
Additionally you will also get to learn about the special characters in German ‚Äì √ü, √ñ, √ú, √Ñ. 
You will also be learning a lot of new words in this video and it is important that you memorise them to further improve your vocabulary. So let's have fun and learn the German alphabets.

lessons.title: Lesson 6 | sich vorstellen | introducing yourself in German
lessons.description:
Being able to introduce yourself in a new language is one of the very first milestones of a language learner. It sure gives you a sense of accomplishment in your language journey. 
In Lesson 6 you will learn to introduce yourself using simple sentences and phrases. By the end of the video you will be able to introduce yourself by mentioning your name, your country, language, age, profession and hobbies. Don't forget to write down all the new words and phrases you learn in this video. 
You can also watch the related videos to know about your country of origin, which language you speak and what profession you practice. At the end of this lesson do remember to w

lessons.title: Lesson 7 | jemanden kennenlernen | Getting to know someone
lessons.description:
Being in a new country and getting to know new people is part of the experience. In the previous lesson you learned how to introduce yourself and in this lesson you will learn how to ask simple questions to get to know someone. Along with that, you will also learn the difference between the two pronouns for YOU (du and Sie) and will learn how to frame questions with both these pronouns. 
At the end of the video there is a quick summary with all the questions you need to ask, to get to know someone. Make sure to repeat the questions and also answer them yourself to practice what you have learned.

lessons.title: Lesson 8 | Wie geht's? | How are you?
lessons.description:
Asking someone "How are you?" and answering the same question is literally the beginning of every conversation, and that's what you will learn in this video. 
You will learn how to start a conversation in German by asking about someone's well-being and replying when asked the same. You will learn both formal and informal ways to ask and answer the question in different ways, depending on how you are feeling at the moment.
The video will end with 2 simple dialogues in both formal and informal manner, so practice along and have fun.

lessons.title: Lesson 9 Common Phrases
lessons.description:
Knowing how to form a basic sentence in a new language is very essential to learning a language in the right way. And in lesson 9 you will learn the sentence structure of simple and basic sentences. 
You will learn how to form basic sentences and questions. The main things that will be covered in this lesson are: 
‚Ä¢        Correct placement of the verb in a sentence. 
‚Ä¢        What is a Subject? 
‚Ä¢        What are W-Questions? 
‚Ä¢        What are Yes-No-Questions?

A simple exercise at the end of the lesson will help you understand the structure easily.

lessons.title: Lesson 10 | Satzstruktur | Sentence Structure Part 2
lessons.description:
Being a continuation of lesson 9, in lesson 10 you will learn the sentence structure of simple sentences. 
Along with learning about the three pronouns ‚Äì "ich, du and Sie", you will also learn how verbs are conjugated in a sentence and what the various verb endings are. 
In the end of the video, there is a small exercise to test you.

lessons.title: Lesson 11 | Personalpronomen | Personal pronouns ich du wir
lessons.description:
In Lesson 11 you will learn various pronouns in the nominative case. 
Following are the main points that will be taught in the video: 
‚Ä¢        What are personal pronouns? 
‚Ä¢        How does one use them? 
‚Ä¢        The German pronouns are gender specific; hence the nouns should be replaced by the appropriate pronouns.
With the help of examples you will understand the use of pronouns for persons and things. The video will end with a summarized table for pronouns. Make sure to note down the table and understand it clearly, because it will be the base of the grammar you will learn in future. 
To practice what you have learned in this video, try to make simple sentence using personal pronouns
